TopicTitle: Is this the most kerbal helicopter ever made?

Articles.Content: Some jobless guy decided to build his own helicopter out of trash: http://www.news24.com/SouthAfrica/News/Jobless-man-builds-helicopter-with-recycled-material-20150619
For this guy's sake, i hope this thing will never get off the ground

Looks heavy.

Don't see any airfoils on the rotor.

No apparent control system for the rotor?

In my estimation he's constructed a helicopter-shaped object.

"The helicopter is incomplete, there are some parts that I have to put in. The challenge is the money. I am not working and depend on odd jobs to build this helicopter." says the builder in article, i still have my doubts about that "helicopter" having flight someday...
Well that is the most creative helicopter that I've ever seen

For decades, scientists dismissed 3 inch box section tubing as a viable rotary-wing aerofoil.

This man found a way!

But he does acknowledge safety concerns...

"Flying is dangerous. I want the helicopter to be inspected for safety before I can fly."

There's a good chap.

Edited June 19, 2015 by wossname

Yes, yes it is a very Kerbal helicopter.

In the sense that it isn't going to fly unless you strap rockets to it.

Yes, yes it is a very Kerbal helicopter.

Agreed, and congratulations. Its adorable in any sense. Me wonders the lacking ejectionseat, but hey, what gives?
Not sure if he knows how aerofoils work, pretty sure *squint* two by fours don't generate (much) lift.
I really feel sorry for this guy. His dream is to fly a helicopter .... and well that thing is never going to fly. Hopefully someone sees this and gives him a ride in a helicopter.
Perhaps it is, but since it's not actually in the game, moved to Space Lounge.

I don't think those square steel tubes will make very good rotors.

But it's not a Kerbal helicopter unless the blades are driven by jet engines
I'd watch that fly... from a distance... just like all my launches!
